definition:
A curve $\alpha : [a, b] \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^{n}$ is said to be
**piecewise smooth** if each component $\alpha_{1}, \ldots, \alpha_{n}$
of $\alpha$ has a bounded derivative
$\alpha_{i}' \quad (i = 1, \ldots, n)$ which is continuous everywhere in
$[a, b]$ except (possibly) at a finite number of points at which left-
and right-sided derivatives exist.

-   Every piecewise smooth curve is rectifiable.

-   Every rectifiable curve can be approximated by piecewise smooth
    curves.
